intro: Chaenactis rubella, commonly known as the pink rayless goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a mat-forming growth pattern. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and often pink or white. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments and provides nectar for pollinators.
